title: Add file watcher to trigger TUI task refresh on external changes
description:
Connect TicksWatcher to TUI to refresh tasks when ticks change externally (e.g., user runs tk approve in another terminal).

Current state:
- TicksWatcher exists in internal/engine/watcher.go
- Only used during engine idle state
- TUI only refreshes after iterations/verification

Implementation approach:
1. Create a separate TicksWatcher in main.go TUI setup (not the engine's watcher)
2. Start goroutine that listens on watcher.Changes() channel
3. On change notification, call refreshTasks()
4. Clean up watcher when TUI exits

File: cmd/ticker/main.go

Add after refreshTasks definition (around line 1140):
```go
// Start file watcher for external tick changes
ticksWatcher := engine.NewTicksWatcher("")
defer ticksWatcher.Close()
if changes := ticksWatcher.Changes(); changes != nil {
    go func() {
        for range changes {
            refreshTasks()
        }
    }()
}
```

Note: The watcher already debounces rapid changes (100ms default).
